item.title: Israeli Strikes in Lebanon Stir Fears of Sectarian Strife
item.description: Lebanon’s religious fault lines are straining as Israel’s war with the Hezbollah militant group grinds on.

item.title: As Beijing Threatens, Taiwan Looks Nervously at Trump
item.description: The president-elect pressed Taiwan during his campaign to spend significantly more to defend against the growing threat of attack by China. Some in Taiwan say it can’t afford to spend what Donald Trump demands.

item.title: Trump's Push for Ukraine Peace Finds Growing Acceptance in Europe
item.description: With U.S. support for Kyiv in doubt, many European officials see diplomacy as the best option for Ukraine.

item.title: As Western Leaders Look to Talks With Putin, Russia Launches Massive Barrage on Ukraine
item.description: Ukrainian officials said the attack looked like an emphatic response by Russian President Vladimir Putin to moves from Kyiv’s allies to seek a peace deal.

item.title: Eight Killed in Knife Attack at Chinese College
item.description: The assault at a college in eastern China is the latest in a string of grisly crimes to unsettle the country.

item.title: Gymnastics Coach Bela Karolyi Dies at 82
item.description: Bela Karolyi rose to fame with Nadia Comaneci and a string of American stars, but he was also accused of contributing to a culture of abuse through his coaching methods.

item.title: China's Heavyweight Coast Guard Ships Bring Muscle to Sea Disputes
item.description: In most countries, the coast guard focuses on law enforcement and rescue. In China, it focuses on enforcing Beijing’s contested maritime claims—with two massive ships leading the charge.

item.title: Xi Tells Biden China Is Ready to Work With Incoming Administration
item.description: The two leaders’ final sit-down, at a summit in Peru, is marked by uncertainty over Trump’s tariff threats.

item.title: Host of the COP29 Climate Talks Is Raining on His Own Parade
item.description: Azerbaijani leader Ilham Aliyev has been praising fossil fuel and taking shots at geopolitical rivals, casting a cloud over the climate summit.

item.title: The Man Expected to Lead Germany Is Ready to Strike Deals With Trump
item.description: A win would give Friedrich Merz the daunting task of rebuilding a German economy that hasn’t grown since 2019—and establish him as Europe’s main counterpart to Donald Trump.

item.title: Killer Robots Are About to Fill Ukrainian Skies
item.description: Kyiv’s drone suppliers are ramping up production of computer-guided drones that are cheap to produce and can’t be electronically jammed.

item.title: Ted Olson, a Towering Figure of the Conservative Legal Movement, Dies at 84
item.description: Olson played a pivotal role in striking down affirmative action and securing George W. Bush’s 2000 victory, but called fighting for same-sex marriage ‘the highlight of my life.’

item.title: The Standoff Deep Inside an Abandoned South African Gold Mine
item.description: The government is trying to starve more than 1,000 informal prospectors out of a shaft of the Buffelsfontein mine, which police say extends some 8,000 feet below ground.

item.title: Iran Told U.S. It Wouldn't Try to Kill Trump
item.description: The written communication last month came after the Biden administration warned Tehran against attempts on Trump’s life.

item.title: Israeli Forces Push Deeper Into Lebanon in Widening War Campaign
item.description: Israel is sending troops into villages farther from its border, in what some former senior security officials worry could turn into a war of attrition.

item.title: North Korea Shows Its Drone Capabilities With Explosive Exhibition
item.description: Improving the regime’s limited drone capabilities has been high on Kim Jong Un’s weapons wishlist.

item.title: China Coped With Trump's First Trade War. A Second One Will Be Tougher.
item.description: Beijing might have little choice but to reconfigure its economy should it become embroiled in a broader trade conflict.

item.title: Smugglers Urge Migrants to Rush to U.S. Before Trump Takes Power
item.description: Many anticipate the president-elect will dismantle legal pathways to entry, including a U.S. government app that is the main portal to claim asylum in the U.S.

item.title: Paris Deploys Thousands of Police for France-Israel Soccer Match After Amsterdam Attacks
item.description: Authorities are ramping up security a week after Israeli fans were attacked in Amsterdam.

item.title: How China Capitalized on U.S. Indifference in Latin America
item.description: Xi Jinping’s visit for summits and the inauguration of a port illustrates what some have called China’s economic marginalization of the U.S. in the region.
